NameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: SISTERS OF MERCY NORTHEAST COMMUNITY IN

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE INTENDED USE OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS IS TO SUPPORT THE OPERATIONAL BUDGET'S STUDENT AID.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The College recognizes the tax benefit from an uncertain tax position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be sustained upon examination by the taxing authorities, based on the technical merits of the tax position. Any tax benefits recognized in the financial statements from such a position are measured based on the largest benefit that has a greater than 50% likelihood of being realized upon ultimate resolution. There are no unrecognized tax benefits that have been recognized in the accompanying financial statements. Each of the tax years in the three-year period ended June 30, 2010 remains subject to examination by the Internal Revenue Service. The College's policy is to recognize interest and penalties related to unrecognized tax benefits (if any) in income tax expense. No such interest and penalties have been accrued as of June 30, 2010 and 2009.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: THE NONDISCRIMINATORY POLICY IS PUBLISHED THROUGH AN ACTIVE RECRUITMENT PROGRAM. BULLETINS AND EMPLOYMENT ADVERTISEMENTS ALSO INCLUDE SUCH POLICIES.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: THE COLLEGE RECEIVED $1,963,393 IN GOVERNMENT FINANCIAL AID.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: REGARDING GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS: Grant payments to University of Maryland and Oregon State University are made after receiving a certified invoice which is reviewed by management and approved for payment. The College has signed written contracts with other sub recipients that require funds to be disbursed on a periodic basis prior to the sub recipient incurring any expenses. Formal grant reporting from the sub recipient is required for each disbursement prior to additional fund disbursements. Grant reporting includes a detailed reporting of all expenses and is reviewed and approved by management. REGARDING GRANTS & ASSISTANCE TO STUDENTS IN THE U.S.: THE COLLEGE DETERMINES THE STUDENTS' ELIGIBILITY PRIOR TO RELEASING THE GRANT, AND THEN MONITORS THEIR ENROLLMENT STATUS AND SATISFACTORY ACADEMIC PROGRESS.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: THE COLLEGE PROVIDED A HOUSING ALLOWANCE TO THE DR. E. JOSEPH LEE, PRESIDENT, IN THE AMOUNT OF $15,000. THE COLLEGE PAID COUNTRY CLUB DUES FOR THE PRESIDENT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 4
Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS ELECTRONICALLY DISTRIBUTED TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BOARD. ANY QUESTIONS, COMMENTS, CONCERNS ARE ADDRESSED PRIOR TO FILING THE FORM WITH THE IRS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRES ARE DISTRIBUTED ANNUALLY TO ALL GOVERNING BOARD MEMBERS AS WELL AS SENIOR MANAGEMENT. THERE IS CONTINUOUS FOLLOW UP UNTIL ALL SIGNED QUESTIONNAIRES HAVE BEEN RECEIVED. ALL CONFLICT OF INTEREST QUESTIONNAIRES ARE REVIEWED BY THE CFO TO DETERMINE IF ANY INFORMATION NEEDS TO BE DISCLOSED IN THE FORM 990.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: LINE 15(a) - THE CHIEF ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICER PERFORMED A SALARY COMPARISON REVIEW OF COLLEGE PRESIDENTS. A SALARY RECOMMENDATION WAS MADE TO THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES WHO IN TURN MADE AN OFFER TO THE EXISTING PRESIDENT. LINE 15(b) - THE DIRECTOR OF HR PERFORMED A SALARY COMPARISON REVIEW FOR THE DEAN OF THE COLLEGE AND THE CFO. SALARY RECOMMENDATIONS WERE MADE TO THE INTERIM PRESIDENT AND PRESIDENT, RESPECTIVELY. DATA FROM THE COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY PROFESSIONAL SALARY ASSOCIATION IS THE SOURCE FOR ALL SALARY COMPARISON REVIEWS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COLLEGE'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS RESIDE IN THE OFFICE OF THE PRESIDENT, AND COPIES ARE DISTRIBUED UPON REQUEST. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND FORM 990 AND 990T ARE ALSO POSTED ELECTRONICALLY ON THE GUIDE STAR WEB SITE WHICH IS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS & SELECTION OF ACCOUNTANT
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THERE HAS BEEN NO CHANGE FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
THE COLLEGE CURRENTLY ADHERES TO THE WHISTLE BLOWER POLICY UNDER FEDERAL LAW.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: WRITTEN DOCUMENT RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION POLICY
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: INDIVIDUAL DEPARTMENTS WITHIN THE COLLEGE HAVE THEIR OWN WRITTEN DOCUMENT RETENTION AND DESTRUCTION POLICIES DEPENDING ON THE NATURE OF THE DOCUMENTS WITHIN THE DEPARTMENT.

SR. MARY GEORGE O'TOOLE, R.S.M. IS AN OFFICER OF THE ORGANIZATION. SHE DOES NOT HAVE ANY REPORTABLE INCOME BECAUSE THE COLLEGE PAYS THE SISTERS OF MERCY NORTHEAST COMMUNITY, INC. A FEE IN LIEU OF SALARY.
